item.title: Module 1: Basics of Excel
item.description: We shall use Microsoft Excel 2013 during the course. So I would suggest the class to install the 2013 version in their computers. Go through the syllabus uploaded in the university website. The references are given in the syllabus. In addition, go through the book Microsoft Excel 2013: Data Analysis and Business Modeling by Wayne L. Winston. 1.1 Introduction 1.2 Few other ‘must know’ things before you begin.

item.title: Module 2: Data Management
item.description: Contents 2.1 Data transformation 2.2 Importing and editing data from text files/documents 2.3 Creating named ranges 2.4 IF() statement (Part - 1) 2.5 The COUNTIF(), COUNTIFS(), COUNT(), COUNTA(), and COUNTBLANK() functions 2.6 The SUMIF(), AVERAGEIF(), SUMIFS(), and AVERAGEIFS() functions 2.7 Sorting 2.8 Filtering and removing duplicates 2.9 Lookup functions 2.1 Data transformation {#2.1} In this lecture we shall cover: Data transformation: arithmetic operation- addition, subtraction, multiplication, log transformation, exponential, squaring and square root, indices.
There are no announcements as of now.
